meanings.definition: Not having acquired knowledge or skill through study or experience.
meanings.sent1: The unlearned child struggled with basic math concepts.
meanings.sent2: She felt unlearned compared to her classmates who had studied the subject for years.
meanings.sent3: The unlearned chef accidentally used salt instead of sugar in the cake.
meanings.sent4: His unlearned approach to fixing the car only made the problem worse.
meanings.sent5: The unlearned traveler got lost in the city despite having a map.

meanings.sent1: The unlearned villagers had never seen a computer before.
meanings.sent2: She felt unlearned when she couldn't understand the classic literature.
meanings.sent3: The unlearned tourist tried to use chopsticks but ended up flinging food everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His unlearned manners at the fancy dinner party shocked the other guests.
meanings.sent5: The unlearned artist painted without any knowledge of famous techniques.

meanings.sent1: The unlearned book was full of simple stories for children.
meanings.sent2: She preferred unlearned novels that didn't require deep analysis.
meanings.sent3: The unlearned debate between the siblings ended in laughter rather than resolution.
meanings.sent4: His unlearned explanation of the theory left everyone confused.
meanings.sent5: The unlearned speech was easy to understand even for those unfamiliar with the topic.
